content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers
The target structure consists of two main parts:
1. A tower/column structure on the right side
2. A stack of blocks on the left side

Total blocks used: 14 blocks

The structure has multiple layers with different components:

## Spatial Relationships
### Right Structure (Tower):
- Base: Two orange cylindrical pillars (index 10) standing vertically
- Middle section: A yellow rectangular block (index 7) connecting the two pillars
- Upper section: A red arch block (index 1) on top of the yellow block
- On top of one pillar: An orange triangular prism (index 14) as the roof
- A yellow semi-circular block (index 11) is placed inside the red arch

### Left Structure (Stack):
- Bottom: A red arch block (index 3)
- Second layer: A green rectangular block (index 4)
- Third layer: A yellow rectangular block (index 8) with a yellow semi-circular block (index 12) on it
- Fourth layer: A green rectangular block (index 5)
- Top: A red arch block (index 1)

# Selected Blocks from Dictionary

Required blocks (with indices):
1. Red arch block (index 1) - used twice
2. Red arch block (index 3) - used once
3. Green rectangular block (index 4) - used once
4. Green rectangular block (index 5) - used once
5. Yellow rectangular block (index 7) - used once
6. Yellow rectangular block (index 8) - used once
7. Orange cylindrical pillar (index 10) - used three times
8. Yellow semi-circular block (index 11) - used once
9. Yellow semi-circular block (index 12) - used once
10. Orange triangular prism (index 14) - used once

# Assembly Order

```
{
   Step1: Move block with index 10
   Step2: Move block with index 10
   Step3: Move block with index 10
   Step4: Move block with index 7
   Step5: Move block with index 1
   Step6: Move block with index 11
   Step7: Move block with index 14
   Step8: Move block with index 3
   Step9: Move block with index 4
   Step10: Move block with index 8
   Step11: Move block with index 12
   Step12: Move block with index 5
   Step13: Move block with index 1
}
```

This assembly order first builds the tower structure (right side) from bottom to top, then constructs the stack (left side) from bottom to top.
